rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great quality, great price, fast shipping options
review: Really fast shipping option was great because I broke my phone. The phone is in excellent condition as described. The screen has one needle pin scratch (literally a teeny tiny dot that is less than a speck of dust) and one scratch that’s less than a mm, which is incredible. I expect some wear and tear, but it is way better than my expectations and experience buying refurbished phones. I’m very pleased. It’s as described if not better. I will be purchasing from this seller again. Great prices and reviews on their page by the way. Works like brand new and it has 86% battery life. Came with a charger box and a chord, very nice of them to include both with the amazing deal it was already at. I would recommend anyone to buy a phone from here and am eyeing another now for family. Thank you so much seller!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Phone works like new.
review: I can hardly believe this phone is refurbished - it seems brand new. I haven't bought refurbished electronics before.I usually hang on to my phones until they quit working and then buy a new one from the wireless provider, but this time I wanted an unlocked phone. It looks new and functions perfectly, and was very reasonably priced for an unlocked phone that will allow me to change wireless providers. Setting up the esim card was a bit complicated for me; I think it's easy to think something isn't working at first. Maybe it depends on your wireless provider, though. I had my tech-savvy daughter help me with the set-up, and it works great.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
1st purchase was great! This one was not!
review: I have had this iPhone for 38 days.It has the worst battery life of any iPhone I've ever owned, and I have owned ONLY iPhones since the first version was released 17 years ago.This is the second iPhone 14 that I've bought from the renewed store .The first one I bought on December 4th, 2023, and I could not have been happier with the phone.It arrived in brand new condition, and performed flawlessly.On the recommendation of a friend, I checked the battery health and charging after having it for MONTHS and it was at 100%! I was thrilled!I absolutely loved the phone!I never had a single problem with it.Unfortunately, on July 30 of this year I dropped it, and it was beyond repair.I immediately went back to the Amazon renewed store and purchased another iPhone 14 because my experience with the first one was so fantastic.It arrived in new looking condition, exactly like the one I bought in December 2023.It was not scratched or anything really noticeable, it just seemed to be "worn" a little bit, but I fully understood that it was a renewed phone, and any cosmetic issues were not that important to me, including the color, which, when my iPhone is in its case, you cannot tell what color it is anyway.Unfortunately, I DID NOT look at the battery health and charging when I first got the phone 38 days ago, but I did look at it about two weeks ago, and it said 93%.I thought, ok, it's a renewed phone, it's not going to have 100% battery life.I can live with that.Well, I just looked at it today and it's now at 90% battery health and charging.So this phone is dying quickly.After being fully charged it dies within hours.I have it completely set up for optimized battery life.I have lost emails and messages that I was in the middle of composing, and the phone just dies.I've been in the middle of important phone calls when the phone dies, simply because I had just fully charged it a few hours before that, and thought I would be fine for hours to come.I just had a total shoulder replacement surgery a week ago, and I was on the phone with my doctors office yesterday about my first post-op appointment, and my phone died in the middle of it.I thought I had HOURS left before the phone would die.Then I had to plug it in, and wait for it to come back alive, so I could call my doctor back and hopefully not wait a half hour after losing my place in line.On top of that is also has issues with the touchscreen being glitchy, and sometimes I have to tap on things several times to get them to work.As I said, I have been an iPhone owner/user since the very first version came out 17 years ago.I've always loved all my iPhones, and I will continue to be an iPhone user for the rest of my life.This is in no way reflection on Apple iPhones whatsoever.They are an amazing and fantastic piece of technology.I think I just got a bad one for the first time in my life.Luckily, I have just checked and I have until November 6th to return this phone, and I WILL be returning it.The problem is, what do I do in the meantime?Am I expected to buy a new one and get that shipped to me, transfer all my information from this phone to the new one, and then return this one?That is extremely hard to do financially!I am actually still paying for this phone on my Amazon Prime American Express card!Or, do I return this phone and wait until the refund has been issued and then buy another phone? Then wait until that is sent to me.I would not have a phone for at least a week in the interim, and we all know these days that's a practical impossibility.I am also having several medical issues.Like I said, I just had a total shoulder replacement surgery last Monday, September 9th, and have several upcoming follow up appointments, and physical therapy appointments.I also have several other non-related medical issues that definitely require that I have a phone.I just don't know what to do.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
5 STARS!!!!!!!! NO COMPLAINTS HERE
review: I ordered this phone in excellent condition and it was just THAT !!! Excellent just like as described . Besides a little dent on the bottom corner of the phone which obviously doesn’t interfere with the functionality of the phone , it other wise looks flawless upon unboxing !!! Not a single scratch . Battery life at 98% when I received it (REALLY GOOD BATTERY LIFE) beyond what I was expecting , and charges really fast with charging cable I’ve already had laying around from old previous phones . Had no problem connecting this phone with my courier . Honestly no complaints on my end . For $400 it’s a major steal I am pleased with my purchase from this seller . If you’re thinking about purchasing a phone from this specific seller , do it . Highly recommend you won’t be disappointed

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Love it 💛💛💛
review: Great phone in great condition. Battery health was a bit low at 90% but was in great condition and works well. I had a it of trouble setting up the Apple ID, I upgraded from an IPhone 12. I had previously disconnected my previous line so no longer have the number. Unfortunately the old number was still connected, so every time I would try to use the Apple ID connected to the iPhone 12 it would send a confirmation code to the phone number so I had no way of using the phone number. So I had to create a new Apple ID and email. Other than that everything works fine and I purchased the yellow option and love the phone and the color is cute!💛💛💛

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Premium
review: After reading other reviews, I decided to go with Amazon Renewed premium. Phone looked like it was new without any scratches or unusual wear. After transferring information from old phone to this one and updated apps, the phone works flawlessly. I found two things wrong and not really wrong, but it did not come with any kind of instructions, and battery life was at 84 percent. I was hoping for higher battery life, but it is what it is. rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great seller, issues with 18.0.1 update and porting old to new phone but found a workaround
review: The seller is great, we had to send back the first phone because we thought it was defective, it turned out that there is a significant conflict with the portability of the old phone information and 18.0.1 upgrade.  When we cut on the phone we set it up to transfer the old phone material first, then it wanted to upgrade the software prior to the transfer.  The upgrade spooled around for 18 hrs, then the portability function (over WiFi and Cloud) simply would not work.  AT&T couldnt figure it out....we sent the phone back thinking it was defective (turns out it was fine), got a new phone same model, etc.New phone had the same issues, and I was thinking at this point it cannot be coincidence so it must me a software conflict.  And....it was.  After MUCH tinkering with it here is the workaround for those of you who are in the same situation (as an aside, we were upgrading my wife's ancient XE to a 14 but I think this happens with a lot of phones no matter the model)1.  Cut on the new phone2.  Opt to NOT set up the new phone with the old phone (ie, do NOT transfer the old phone data yet).3.  Go to settings, opt to update the software to 18.0.14.  After this, ERASE the phone.  It will keep 18.0.1 on there, it will remove any impediments to port over the information.5.  KEEP the e-sim information on there(it gives you that option when you erase, it is ok not to do it but you will have to put it back on so just keep it on).6.  Boot the phone back up7.  OPT to set it up with the old phone (likely the older phone will prompt you for this first).8.  You can set it up over Wifi or Cloud, make sure you have backed up the old phone on the cloud just before set up if you opt for that.9.  There is an option to use direct cabling to transfer, but it is a pain because Apple insists on using the proprietary cabling they have, so it means you have to first port everything onto a laptop then transfer it.  Safer but not any quicker.  I would not do that unless you have cloud issues and/or bad WiFi.Phone has worked great since we did the workaround, and I want to compliment the seller as they were quick to send a replacement phone to us and very communicative on the issues.  I hope the workaround here helps others, it was utterly baffling to us.  Apple needs to get it together on the portability issues since they just released the new model and apparently this is an issue with a number of older to newer transfers, very disappointing for them to not catch this.
lowercased: the seller is great, we had to send back the first phone because we thought it was defective, it turned out that there is a significant conflict with the portability of the old phone information and 18.0.1 upgrade.  when we cut on the phone we set it up to transfer the old phone material first, then it wanted to upgrade the software prior to the transfer.  the upgrade spooled around for 18 hrs, then the portability function (over wifi and cloud) simply would not work.  at&t couldnt figure it out....we sent the phone back thinking it was defective (turns out it was fine), got a new phone same model, etc.new phone had the same issues, and i was thinking at this point it cannot be coincidence so it must me a software conflict.  and....it was.  after much tinkering with it here is the workaround for those of you who are in the same situation (as an aside, we were upgrading my wife's ancient xe to a 14 but i think this happens with a lot of phones no matter the model)1.  cut on the new phone2.  opt to not set up the new phone with the old phone (ie, do not transfer the old phone data yet).3.  go to settings, opt to update the software to 18.0.14.  after this, erase the phone.  it will keep 18.0.1 on there, it will remove any impediments to port over the information.5.  keep the e-sim information on there(it gives you that option when you erase, it is ok not to do it but you will have to put it back on so just keep it on).6.  boot the phone back up7.  opt to set it up with the old phone (likely the older phone will prompt you for this first).8.  you can set it up over wifi or cloud, make sure you have backed up the old phone on the cloud just before set up if you opt for that.9.  there is an option to use direct cabling to transfer, but it is a pain because apple insists on using the proprietary cabling they have, so it means you have to first port everything onto a laptop then transfer it.  safer but not any quicker.  i would not do that unless you have cloud issues and/or bad wifi.phone has worked great since we did the workaround, and i want to compliment the seller as they were quick to send a replacement phone to us and very communicative on the issues.  i hope the workaround here helps others, it was utterly baffling to us.  apple needs to get it together on the portability issues since they just released the new model and apparently this is an issue with a number of older to newer transfers, very disappointing for them to not catch this.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Refurbished, but not “like new”
review: I purchased this as I wanted a newer phone and this seemed a less expensive way to go. I was a refurbished iPhone 14. It came in a nice box and a charger cable, but not a charger. Not usually a problem as most people over time accumulate several them over time. It looked brand new and works fine. Unfortunately, I had assumed that refurbished meant “like new”, but apparently it also means “it was checked out, cleaned up and it works”. What it does not mean is a new battery. Mine had a battery with 84% charge capacity. In fairness, the company’s fine print indicates this so that’s on me to have overlooked that. In fairness I did get a “newer” phone just not one that was “like new” which meant like a new one, not just close. So, the iPhone is a newer one and works well, just will not hold a charge as long. If that doesn’t matter then this a good choice.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Used iPhone 14 Excellent
review: iPhone showed up in like new condition.  Came with lightning cable.  In case someone else runs into the issue I did.  We use Visible which says it’s by Verizon so I assumed (incorrectly) that I could use a Verizon locked phone.  It did not work so I had to return the first phone I bought and I purchased an unlocked phone.  Everything transferred over from my old phone just fine and everything is working great.  No complaints!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Experiencia 10 de 10 Muy Recomendable Batería al 100%
review: Quejas? ¡Ninguna! Estaba un poco nervioso por realizar esta compra ya que es la primera vez que compro algo “renovado” y que buena experiencia primeriza me he llevado. El iPhone llegó en EXCELENTE estado con la capacidad de batería al 100% y nuevo (Revisando el número de serie verifiqué que, en efecto, el celular es nuevo).Sin rasguños de ningún tipo, quizá un rayón diminuto en la pantalla que es imperceptible a primera vista a menos que lo observes cuidadosamente. La batería le dura 1 día y medio a 2 dependiendo del uso que le dé. Esperé una semana para testearlo bien y escribir una reseña correcta para que las demás personas sepan bien cual fue mi experiencia y así facilitar la compra de otros clientes. En fin, estoy satisfecho con mi compra. Gracias al vendedor por enviarme el producto rápido.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Couldn’t get this phone on my xfinity network but no problem getting a refund
review: I tried to save myself some money and having to renew my xfinity plan for another 24 months by buying a refurbished iPhone 14 for my son. The phone looked brand new but even though it was unlocked we spent hours on the phone with xfinity and in person trying to get it on my xfinity account.  Very frustrating.  Even called apple but no one could figure out what was wrong.  I finally gave up and bought a new iPhone 14 from xfinity.  The seller was great about issuing a refund. It actually happened very quickly.  In hindsight I wish I had just bought the new one from xfinity to start with.  I gave the seller a 5 cause I don’t think it was their fault.  I did email him twice and the answers back didn’t really help much but they were responsive with the refund.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
88% battery life. We will see...
review: Pretty much the most important thing about an iPhone that matters more than a camera, some scratches, and even the overall iPhone is, and will always be, the battery percentage.Mine is 88% for the excellent condition. I just hope this lasts, as I bought it for use in Peru and not the states. So, charging your phone is a whole lot less convenient when not in the US, surrounded by chargers and plugs/outlets.I will update this within a few months to see the battery life and how it will hold up.Other than that, it looks great; it even got a USB-A cable + charger box, which is a plus.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2024
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Ordered a phone in good condition and mostly happy with it
review: Ordered a phone in good condition. According to Amazon there isn’t supposed to be any scratches on the screen when it is in good condition. There are 2 deep scratches and smaller scratches on the screen. Not upset about it but it doesn’t follow what Amazon says. Battery was at 100% health so It makes up for the scratches. But i am a bit disappointed in that there were scratchesBesides that the phone is in good condition, was a bit of scuff marks on the side but a case hid that. The speakers are loud, was fully unlocked and was able to switch it over to my carrier easily. Was worried when I saw reviews saying the phone wasn’t unlocked but I didn’t have that issue.Overall I’m happy with the phone, just the scratches were disappointing.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
So far so good!
review: Battery life is at 86%, sure the iPhone has defects and some weird dirt/rust on the back of camera but I haven’t had any issues yet as I’m setting it up. I can’t speak for other customers who have had issues but so far so good!Edit after a week: It was some weird junk on the back camera, the phone has to scratches or any dents and has been working properly. Only downside is that the camera doesn’t detect QR codes. That’s not a deal breaker for me. Glad it works and satisfied for a used iPhone 14!!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2024
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
“Excellent, like new” condition
review: Phone arrived packaged nicely and included charging cube and cord.  I had to present my drivers license and sign for it when FedEx delivered it.  Some scratches on the sides, but front and back screen look new.  Very disappointed however to check the battery health and it only be at 85%.  I would have thought that an “excellent, like new” phone would’ve came with a new battery since that has always been my experience with Apple refurbished products. (I do realize this is not a certified Apple refurbished product) I purchased this as a gift for my daughter, so no time to return and get a different phone.  For the price paid, I would’ve expected a “like new” phone that has a new battery.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2024
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
Better off getting a new one
review: All of this was experienced in the span of about 24-48 hours, and due to my work, I couldn’t keep the device because of the performance issues experienced:I needed a phone quick because my last phone died. While I appreciate the quick turn around on my order and delivery, the device had issues.For starters, the refurbished one I ordered and received took a long time to set up. You couldn’t just pair it with another device to get everything transferred. If you tried this, you would see the latest update would take days to complete and the timeline never changed.I reached out to apple and they helped me get it set up, however, there were several performance issues with the device I received.Total time it took to get the phone set up: 6.5 hours.Details: Started at 4pm as soon as the device was delivered, and after seeing the update was still not completed around 9pm, I worked with Apple support to get the device finally set up around 10pm.Performance issues:The charging port was loose, so even if the device was connected to a plug in charger, it wouldn’t always charge. This also impacted connection to CarPlay when driving. The phone would be sitting in the seat beside me, plugged in, but if it moved slightly, the connection wouldn’t work and I’d have to unplug it and plug it back in. It’s not tight enough to keep a good connection.There was an issue with screen responsiveness and phantom typing. If you needed to tap or select anything closer to the edge of the screen, it wouldn’t register. At times the screen wouldn’t respond at all, or if it was face down and I picked it up, I would see it was randomly typing characters in the Home Screen search box. I would have to manually turn the screen off (side button) for it to stop.There was also an issue with the front facing camera and sensor. The camera was really fuzzy and not able to pick up anything at times. The sensor wouldn’t always correctly adjust the screen brightness over the night I had it.The physical device itself also has scratches and dents all over it. While I don’t care about cosmetic as much as the above, the phone I received was more along the lines of poor condition overall.For this seller, I think it would be a good idea to do more intensive performance testing with the phones/devices before you send them out. You should also include correct setup instructions with the devices so your customers can set them running with ease and not have to waste half a day trying to get the phone setup to work.Overall, with the issues and hassle I experienced with the device I was sent, it was more cost effective to go buy the same model in new condition for the additional $100 at a local Best Buy.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
great value for money
review: First off, the phone is incredibly smooth to use. Everything runs without a hitch—whether it’s basic tasks or heavy apps, it’s fast and responsive. No lag at all, which makes the experience so enjoyable.Then there’s the design—it looks amazing! The sleek and stylish build feels premium in hand. It’s simple but classy, and honestly, it’s way better than I expected.The camera is another highlight. Photos and videos come out super clear, with vibrant colors and sharp details. If you love capturing moments, this phone is perfect.And let’s talk about the price—such great value for money! For what it offers, it’s an absolute steal. I honestly feel like I got more than what I paid for.All in all, this is a fantastic phone and totally worth buying. I’d recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat. Thanks, Amazon, for an awesome product!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Quality
review: Just ordered this phone and overall it is decent for the price it is a very nice phone however it does have some flaws for example there is not much many settings for the phone so you are limited on options on settings pretty much it is basic settings as well as on top of screen when you scroll down with your finger basic options so overall I found it to simple yet it is nice for price of this phone. One thing I dislike is the sound quality when your taking on the phone there's no advance options to increase volume so the volume is lower than expected compared to other phones and I already have the volume as high it can be however it does sound clear so that helps to hear what the person is saying yet it would be really nice if it did have an advanced option to increase volume one thing I did notice was the last update in 2020? Not sure if it is suppose to be like that but I tried updating and says it is up to date? So that's a little odd other than those things overall decent satisfied but you get what you pay for right?UPDATE!Phone lasted 2 months and the screen is literally coming off as shown in the pic now i have to either get it fixed which i dont find it worth it!

higher quality

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
It's got a lot of texture.
review: The black and white filter that comes with the phone works surprisingly well! The contrast and layering are so strong that you can take very textured photos. Especially when shooting street or humanities subjects, the black and white mode can make the picture more storytelling. rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Wonderful product and would recommend!
review: I had an older android and was having a hard time deciding what, and when to get, a new phone. I love Android and I was really intrigued with the Google and Asus phones. I have had a galaxy since the beginning of smart phones it would seem. Well, looking at all options as well, the red iPhone caught my attention solely in color. I know IPhone is a good phone, for the most part, everyone I know seems to have iPhone or Galaxy. I have never owned an iPhone and they are much more expensive than the phones I was looking at. But the red iPhone, I just kept coming back to. I started looking into the differences, and then started looking into refurbished. I have also never purchased a refurbished phone. The price difference for a “Premium” or “excellent” condition iPhone, was significantly cheaper than buying brand new. I went back and forth on Amazon, with different sellers based on reviews, and ended up landing in the option where it is sold and shipped by Amazon themselves (which I thought was more likely to be exactly what is described in their product page). I will say the first try to purchase did not go through, so there were some issues with the monthly insurance plan for the phone. But the second time it did go through, and I was having to wait probably 4 days for it to get here. I was so excited, like a kid waiting for Christmas to get here.Finally the iPhone arrived, and in absolute perfect condition. I went with the “premium refurbished” option. The delivery was incredibly secure and the driver was extra helpful before they arrived so we could time it. I opened the box and there is not one scratch or thing that would tell you that this isn’t a brand new phone. It comes with a charger, block and the phone information on a leaflet (that would otherwise be in the original iPhone packaging). I did wait to activate it, until I had time to go into a physical carrier store, but I backed up everything before I did that in my old phone. It took maybe 5 minutes for the associate at my carrier store, to set the iPhone up and transfer everything I wanted from my galaxy and the service, to the iPhone. I was worried based on other reviews that it could possibly not be unlocked to all carriers, but it was. One of the main reasons I chose to buy the refurbished option from the sold by/ships by Amazon option, because I trusted the accuracy of the description more.ALL THAT SAID beautiful phone, looks brand new, works like it’s brand new, has 100% battery life out of the box and is very easy to get used to (even if you have had an android all your adult life). I definitely recommend this product and Amazon as the seller to ensure you get what you are looking for. I am SO happy with my purchase and when it comes time to get a new phone a few years from now, I will be starting here this time! The RED color is beautiful!!!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone 14 Amazon Renewed Premium sold by Amazon
review: Amazon iPhone 14 ReviewRather than going into all the nifty  upgraded details and features of the IPhone 14, this will be more of a summary of some key features with emphasis on Amazon’s  renewed /refurbished program for IPhones.iPhone 14 is a terrific phone with very good battery life especially compared to the previous iPhone mini iterations which sports smaller batteries.  Also, Apple has removed the physical SIM slot for IPhone 14 for US customers.Transitioning and transferring data from a physical sim from an older iPhone to iPhone 14 wasn’t difficult.  It was fairly similar to the previous method:  having stable network/wifi, bringing the iPhones together and just follow the instructions as they come up.  It would seem that there may be cases where a bit of hiccup may occur during the data transfer when the WiFi/network is lost, as was the case for us.  Initially, both the old and new iPhone was on the home network/wifi, but midway through, iPhone 14 reverted to cellular network 5g.  As a result, the data transfer took slightly longer than expected but still managed to complete within 1.5hours.  This was approximately 175gb of data using the 5g cellular network because of the WiFi/home network faux pas (disconnection).This is the 3rd time we’ve ordered through Amazon’s Renewed Premium program (pre-owned/refurbished). The first 2 times was actually sold by a third party.  Our experiences have been decent, given the discounted price and reasonably decent quality as advertised.This time for the IPhone 14, we decided to go with Amazon Renewed Premium and actually sold by Amazon.  Given the same price or even slightly higher we believe it to be a very worthwhile move.  See attached pictures for the packaging, the care/attention and assurance of quality & condition.Amazon also have renewed conditions of Excellent, Good and Acceptable.  Depending on the needs and budget they may be suitable alternatives.  However, since we have not made purchases in these conditions we won’t be able post comments or reviews.The price for the condition and quality has definitely exceeded our expectations this time around.  It’s possible that we may have been lucky this time around or perhaps  Amazon has higher standards, thus products (especially pre-owned/refurbished) sold directly by Amazonhave higher probability of being consistently exceptional when compared to third party.Nevertheless, as we are quite impressed and satisfied with Amazon Renewed Premium condition sold by Amazon, that will be our likely first choice going forward.  The second choice will be Amazon renewed Premium condition sold by third party.It has been approximately 5 weeks since we’ve received and have been using the phone.  So far so good, battery capacity remains at 100%.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Brick Stolen Device
review: If I could send negative stars I would. The phone looked great and it was a great deal;however the device was unable to be activated due to it being reported lost or stolen. This was for a teenager who had already been without a phone for 3days now having to return the device. The customer service representative had no idea what I was talking about. I’ve worked in the cell phone industry, when a phone especially an iPhone is reported lost or stolen you cannot activate the device ANYWHERE hence the name brick it’s basically as good as a brick. I was told nothing could be done about it while I just ship the phone back half to waive for my $700 to be refunded to me while my teenager is still waiting without a phone and I’m without money. I’ve also had all carriers and not one made me sit without a phone or a refund processed right away. To top it off I asked to speak to a supervisor and when I told the supervisor the phone was reported lost or stolen she called me a liar and told me that’s simply not true!! Amazon did not do its due diligence by inspecting the phone properly. There is a national database for lost/stolen phones if they did they job accurately and checked not one but both the IMEI’s since it only has an eSIM they would have caught that it was reported! But for an Amazon employee to call me a liar? Are you kidding me? Don’t buy a “renewed” device from Amazon or risk having a yourself $500-$700 brick losing out of money and being without a phone! Not even an adjustments credits nothing but being humiliated without money and no product.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
‼️🚨 BEST RENEWED IPHONE
review: Overall Review ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️- This was a super easy, affordable and quick solution to buying a phone in a pinch. I ordered the product at 3pm on a Thursday and it was delivered at my door by Friday lunch time.-The product came in the normal Amazon box packing with paper to insure a safe travel. The phone itself is in amazing condition, works great and is infact unlocked.Product Condition 🔥-This iPhone had NO scratches NO dents and came prepackaged in amazons official renewal packaging. The phone itself was even wrapped in a plastic film to protect it.-The touch screen works great and has no scratches.- The camera has no scratches and the picture quality is 10/10.-My speaker works great and is loud 📢 compared to my previous phone.-The phone even came with a charger.Cons-The phone did not come charged so I had to charge it when it arrived.-The product was not up to date so I had to play around with set up

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Looks brand new, works great so far.
review: Bought this iPhone 14 512gb, it seems brand new: no marks whatsoever on the front, back or sides, battery capacity 100%. Unfortunately warranty coverage has already expired, but didn't expect that for the price paid nor was it advertised as part of the deal: nothing to complain about. I confess I was a little uncomfortable with the "gamble" of buying a renewed phone but for the time being it's been working like charm. Been using it in my hometown (Buenos Aires, Argentina) and 5G coverage has very fast downloads. Battery after a day of heavy use still has at least 20% remaining. Finally replaced my old iPhone 11 and i'm very happy with my purchase. I completely recommend buying this phone!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great phone

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2024
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
"premium"... "PREMIUM"...?
review: I ordered this with the assumption that I would receive a 8-9/10 second hand phone, which, in some cases, it was.  The physical condition was good, it turned right on.  After finally getting everything moved over I was greeted with an unexpected less-than-stellar message on my screen stating that the phone had an unsupported/unrecognized component (the screen).  This message is persistent, leaving a badge on the settings on the settings icon.  Definitely not a "premium" experience, to say the least, but alas, here we were.  I decided, it's fine, I'll keep it regardless- I can get past the notifications about the 3rd party component, albeit an annoying reminder of the term "premium".  I purchased another refurbished phone, this time from a different vendor on Amazon -  an iPhone 15 plus for my mother.  The phone is perfect, no issues whatsoever, now this, this felt closer to "premium".  I only mention that because I did not purchase the "premium" version of there refurbished devices.Fast forward a few days, my phone dies, gee.  Seems like I'm constantly charging this phone... Maybe it's placebo, maybe it's "premium" - who knows.  After the phone dies, I plug it in, but I'm not getting the battery icon to show up. I let it sit for a while, knowing it's on an oem charger and brick.  I go to turn it on, and it's not.. doing anything.  I go to reset the phone maybe, holding the volume up + unlock button. My flash begins to turn on and off, and a siren starts to play anytime I hold it!  After googling the symptoms, I come across something talking about it's caused from major hardware failure - aka the "premium" experience! Turns out it was activating SOS mode, nice!  Disgruntled, I decided maybe I should return this device, maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole "premium" experience, I should've just stayed in my lane.  With my mastering of the arts of the procrastinator, I quickly shelved the thought and moved on it from as I need a phone pretty much always (totally not for short form content consumption and totally for important business delegations), and I get a sneaking suspicious the return process is going to have some "premium" surprised in store for me.  But this phone, this phone knew I wasn't the "premium" user it was made to furnish, and has since locked up two more times with scan lines littered throughout the screen, ahem, I mean, "premium" scan lines.So here we are - my "premium" procrastination skills have been tested and found to bear fault, so I began the return process and ordered a new phone, this time, though.. Although the phone I ordered isn't "premium", it's considered excellent, and here's to hoping I don't end up having to pay a "premium" for some excellence.tldr; It's a refurbished phone, there will be quirks and mistakes, but don't label something as premium with a jank screen, I didn't even get into the details about how the image quality was very subpar on the device, not sharp, dull, slow, unresponsive at times, etc.  The condition of the phone is good and I can only assume that is the extent that Amazon inspects these devices outside of turning on and turning off to determine functionality.  The only premium with this product unfortunately was the pricing!

 after googling the symptoms, i come across something talking about it's caused from major hardware failure - aka the "premium" experience! turns out it was activating sos mode, nice!  disgruntled, i decided maybe i should return this device, maybe i'm just not cut out for this whole "premium" experience, i should've just stayed in my lane.  with my mastering of the arts of the procrastinator, i quickly shelved the thought and moved on it from as i need a phone pretty much always (totally not for short form content consumption and totally for important business delegations), and i get a sneaking suspicious the return process is going to have some "premium" surprised in store for me.  but this phone, this phone knew i wasn't the "premium" user it was made to furnish, and has since locked up two more times with scan lines littered throughout the screen, ahem, i mean, "premium" scan lines.so here we are - my "premium" procrastination skills have been tested and found to bear fault, so i began the return process and ordered a new phone, this time, though.. although the phone i ordered isn't "premium", it's considered excellent, and here's to hoping i don't end up having to pay a "premium" for some excellence.tldr; it's a refurbished phone, there will be quirks and mistakes, but don't label something as premium with a jank screen, i didn't even get into the details about how the image quality was very subpar on the device, not sharp, dull, slow, unresponsive at times, etc.  the condition of the phone is good and i can only assume that is the extent that amazon inspects these devices outside of turning on and turning off to determine functionality.  the only premium with this product unfortunately was the pricing!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great quality, 100% battery health, verizon users should use the app for activation
review: appears brand new with 100% battery health. A tip for verizon users (like me) so you don’t waste hours (like me): migrate your data to your new iphone, update the ios over wifi, and then use the verizon APP for the cellular activation. Do not use the verizon website, it doesn’t work for a new activation like this. I wasted hours on the website and on the phone with a customer service rep and I finally loaded the app which recognized the device and activated easily. Would purchase again.

title:

review: So trying to save a knickle (so to speak) I decided to buy my wife a Refubished phone here on amazon for a gift.Big mistake!The phone we received IMMEDIATELY started having problems with charging. I think almost from the very day she got it & plugged in it. Unfortunately my buying a cheaper phone trying to save some knickles end up in some heated conservations & finally we decided it had to be returned.The good news is that the service i recieved from Tigerphones was very prompt & they did what they say they were going to do, includingreturning the entire cost of the phone to me quickly. I  WAS VERY IMPRESSED BY the company, that I had bought the phone from BUT not with the phone.Thank you very much for your excellent service & propt attention!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2024
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Updated: Unlocked, but will not accept my eSim
review: I just got the phone, which had a US AT&T cell number registered to it…and for the past two days, I’ve been unable to transfer or add my eSIM to the phone. I brought it to my local network provider today and they were unable to activate it or connect it to a new eSIM.I will now have to find a way to return it to Amazon because I live outside the US. This is highly inconvenient and I fear it may happen if I try to purchase another one. I’m thinking the phone must be lockedUpdated: I took the phone to a phone expert over two separate days, who confirmed the phone was infact unlocked, but still cannot identify what prevented the phone from accepting the new sims. I’ve since gotten the new eSIMs attached, so I did not return the phone. Ultimately, this still left me on edge and made me anxious for a bit longer than necessary. The phone works very well now

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Couldn’t connect it to my cell service carrier.
review: Pros:-No cracks or scratches-Is an official iPhone 14-Was able to turn it on and set it upCons:-Couldn't connect the phone to get service. Trust me when I say I tried. I am a loyal Straight Talk customer, so when I got this unlocked phone, I immediately tried to switch my current service over. As the 14 is ESIM only, I tried transferring it from nearby phone. It told me that my service was invalid to transfer to eSim. Weird, but no worries. I went to the straight talk site and tried setting up new service for the 14. It told me that the IMEI and IMEI2 were invalid. I called straight talk and texted them, and they both said it was invalid and kept asking if I was sure it was a 14. After hours of trying with straight talk, I decided to try Mint Mobile. Entered my IMEI2 and they said it was compatible. So I bought a plan with them and started the process of adding an eSim with them. Only to be told that it was unable to activate the eSim. Again, I tried for hours troubleshooting any problems with mint mobile customer service and even ordered a replacement eSim. I restarted the process and was told once more that it was unable to activate the eSim. I tried searching the problem myself and came up with nothing. At this point, I wasted a lot of time trying to set it up and it all led nowhere. So, only 48 after getting the phone, I returned it and will hopefully receive my refund soon.Conclusion:If you want to take a chance, go for it, as there’s other reviews stating that the phone worked for them. I can’t say for sure whether it was a prepaid plan issue, an apple issue, or an Amazon issue, but I just know I couldn’t get what I needed from the phone. I’m keeping the review at 3 stars, because although I had to return it after it giving me a lot of trouble, everything else from the delivery to the state of the phone was perfect. I wish you better luck than I had if you order!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Premium Renewed 100% worth it.
review: Got this for my mom after buying a different renewed iPhone that had a bowed screen (tried many screen protectors a none would fit properly) and it had a bad charging port. The Amazon Premium renewed option is definitely the way to go. Screen was flawless (no scratches or anything) in fact, the iPhone was practically brand new. Couldn’t even tell it was used (which by the warranty still on the phone, it was only 4ish months old.) Got extra lucky with the one we got since the battery was at 100% capacity and the iPhone still has Apple Care for nearly a whole year. Wish I would have just gotten her this one right away, even if it was $100 more. The phone quality alone was worth it. Not everyone will be quite as lucky, but I’m sure you’ll receive a phone well worth the “Premium” Renewed name.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
wrong carrier
review: ok, so the quality of the product was great. the phones were in great condition, couldn't be happier about that. but here is the problem. i paid for the ones that belong to the at&t carrier. but when i took them to at&t to get activated, they told me that they were locked to another carrier. so after running around and trying to get them unlocked, i find out that i got sent tmobile ones. i ended up having to get them unlocked thru an independent business, because At&t wouldnt help me, and the apple store really wouldn't help me. if they wouldve just sent me the right phones from the start then there would be absolutely no issues with my purchase. but i see this is somewhat of a common issue here.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
First one could not be activated because it was stolen
review: The first one we ordered was a huge headache. Three hours at the phone store trying to activate it only to find out that it was blacklisted because the previous owner had reported it as stolen. That made for a very sad Christmas holiday while we waited for another one. I’m giving it 3 stars because the second one works flawlessly. I have to be careful what to say here to not violate the rules, so I’ll just say this - the second was from a 3rd party seller (with good reviews). Overall, I’m pretty disappointed with the quality control, but everyone is happy now

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2024
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
Most frustrating phone I’ve ever dealt with
review: First off I just want to say if I didn’t previously have an iPhone this process would have been even more frustrating. Open the package and there’s no charger in the box. If I didn’t previously have an iPhone I wouldn’t have been able to charge the phone because when I powered on the iPhone the battery was dead, so luckily, I already had an iPhone to begin with otherwise I would’ve been screwed and I had to go out of my way to go buy a charger. now with setting up the phone was also kind of difficult since I had to switch over from a physical sim to an e-sim so I recommend making an appointment prior with your internet provider to get that switch over and make it an easier process. now with that being said ever since I got the phone the front camera worked perfectly at first and then after a few days is now blurry. I’ve done some research and I’ve done all of the things online to try and make it un blurry and it’s still blurry . The phone does not hold a charge even though the battery is at maximum capacity of 100% it takes about four hours to reach a full hundred percent charge with that. I also still didn’t get the charger along with that so that also could be a reason why it’s taking so long to charge. I’m not really sure. I can’t even update the iPhone to the newest iOS update even though the phone is at over 50Percent , the picture I have shown above was not when I first attempted to try and update the phone for anyone curious in that regard. In my personal opinion I’ll probably be returning the phone and just going straight to the Apple Store and just spending $100 more rather than having to deal with this. Hopefully some of y’all can learn from my experience and just go out of your way and spend a little bit more money to get what you’re actually looking for. The price is not worth the hassle in my opinion.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Like new with 1 year Amazon warranty
review: I was nervous after reading reviews about phones that had imperfect screens or weren't unlocked, but I couldn't be happier with my purchase so far. It truly appears brand new. I couldn't find a single scratch or smudge on the screen or body of the phone, and the battery health says it's 100%. It's a dual eSIM phone, as expected, and per an online IMEI lookup, both are unlocked. Also, Amazon doesn't make it easy to find the terms of its "Renewed" and "Renewed Premium" program, but the renewed has a 90-day warranty and the premium has 1 year. I think the price differential is worth it for the longer warranty. As for the phone itself: I wish it were a little thinner, like my old iPhone SE, but in exchange for the extra size I have a much better battery and significantly larger screen. I don't like the lavender color I chose - it's so pale it looks more like a dirty white. But that's my bad for choosing a color without finding a real world example to look at first.I have a prepaid Verizon plan and it was a bit of a pain to transition from my old phone, with its physical SIM, to the new eSIM phone, but I got it done at the Verizon store in about half an hour. (Efforts to get help by phone or Verizon chat were useless.)

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2025
title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
Not able to insure
review: Title: Great Phone, But Lacking Insurance OptionsI recently purchased this phone and received it quickly, which was impressive. The device works great and has exceeded my expectations in terms of performance and features. However, I encountered a significant issue: I was unable to buy insurance for the phone through Apple.Given the amount I invested, the lack of insurance options makes me feel uneasy about potential damage or loss. This has rendered the phone somewhat useless for me, as I worry about the risks without coverage.While I am happy with the phone itself, I wish Apple offered more accessible insurance options for customers. If you’re considering this phone, be sure to explore your insurance options before making a purchase.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great Phone
review: This is my first iPhone. Always had android up till I got this phone. It was in excellent condition and really looked like a new one. Still has very good battery life left. The seller I bought this from was very helpful with any question I had. NETWORKSTORE BTW. Even showed up a day early. So if you buy something and you see this is the seller don't be afraid to pull the trigger on it. You won't be disappointed. Overall a great phone and a great experience. Hope I continue to love this phone after so long being on android.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Practically brand new
review: From the description of the listing I was expecting a near new phone with minimal wear. What I got was a phone that is practically new, inside and out. Everything works as expected on it, the battery shows 100% capacity, there isnt a single scratch on either the glass or metal. Not even where you plug it in to charge. The previous owner must have used it for a short period of time and kept it in a case. The package was alright, the included charger and brick is straight up e-waste and if Amazon really cared about the environment they would either include a real apple charger or nothing at all. That being said I could care less about the included charger since I already have one and was expecting it to be trash since they only specified it would be compliant to apple's standards. This review is for a Renewed Premium so keep thar in mind.

review: I saved over $100 by buying it renewed and got pretty much a brand new iPhone 14. The only catch was, I had to go through 5 customer service representatives with my carrier to get it transferred over. Have another phone available besides the one you’re trying to transfer. I had to use someone else’s phone just to get mine activated.Overall worth saving over $100 for 4 hours of phone calls tho

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Battery & Charging
review: Battery endurance is PHENOMENAL!  As a delivery driver, I’m on GPS/music for 12+ hours daily – this phone still has 20% left when I get home.  The 65W charger refuels it to 80% during my 30-minute lunch break.  I’ve tested battery health after 3 months: still 98% capacity thanks to smart charging tech that stops at 100% until morning.  The reverse charging even juiced up my friend’s dead AirPods during a road trip.  Truly a workhorse!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great value
review: After searching for the best deal on an iPhone 15 Pro Max, I decided to take a chance on this Verizon-carrier refurbished model from Amazon with 256GB storage. I couldn't be happier with my decision!Condition: Virtually FlawlessFirst and foremost, if you're hesitant about buying refurbished, don't be—at least not with this listing. My phone arrived in what appears to be pristine condition. No scratches, scuffs, or signs of previous use. The screen is perfect, and the titanium frame looks brand new. If I hadn't known it was refurbished, I would have assumed it was a new device.Performance & Battery Life: Zero CompromisesThe A17 Pro chip in this phone is blazing fast. Apps open instantly, gaming performance is stellar, and I haven't experienced any slowdowns or crashes. The 256GB of storage is the sweet spot for me—plenty of room for photos, videos, and apps without paying for excessive storage I wouldn't use.Battery life has been exceptional. I easily get through a full day of heavy use with 20-30% battery remaining. Fast charging and MagSafe compatibility work perfectly as expected. Camera System: Professional-Quality ResultsThe camera system on the iPhone 15 Pro Max continues to impress me daily. The 48MP main camera captures incredible detail, and the ultrawide and telephoto lenses give me creative flexibility I never had with previous phones. The Action button makes accessing the camera lightning fast, and the results are consistently stunning even in challenging lighting conditions.Verizon Carrier ExperienceActivation with Verizon was seamless. The phone came ready to connect to the network, and I haven't experienced any carrier-specific issues. Call quality is excellent, and 5G performance is fast and reliable in my area.Value: UnbeatableThe substantial savings compared to buying new made this purchase a no-brainer. Getting essentially the same experience as a new iPhone 15 Pro Max at a reduced price feels like a smart financial decision.Bottom LineIf you're considering this refurbished iPhone 15 Pro Max from Verizon through Amazon, I highly recommend it. The combination of like-new condition, full functionality, and significant cost savings makes this one of the best tech purchases I've made. This is how refurbished products should be—indistinguishable from new but easier on your wallet.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best phone I’ve ever had!!!
review: I’m so glad I bought this phone! I’ve never had a newer phone and buying from Amazon was wayyy cheaper than buying from any carrier or even apple themselves. The battery life is at 100% and when I got the phone the cycle count was only 125. No scratches, nicks or cracks the phone was in perfect condition (very thankful for that.) For shipping it did arrive a day late but I’m sure it was just fedexs problem otherwise it came within 3-4 days of ordering. I also had no problem setting it up by myself.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Definitely regret this purchase…
review: Extremely Disappointed with “Excellent” Refurbished iPhoneI am beyond disappointed with this purchase. I bought this phone based on the description that it was “excellent refurbished” condition, but that couldn’t be further from the truth. Here’s why I’m giving this a 1-star rating: 1. Overheating Issues: The phone gets hot very quickly during basic use, even when just browsing or texting. It’s uncomfortable to hold and concerning for long-term use. 2. Battery Life is Terrible: Despite the description claiming the battery was at 98%, the phone drains ridiculously fast. I can barely make it through a few hours before needing to charge again. For a phone advertised as “excellent,” this is unacceptable. 3. Scuffed Camera: The camera has visible scuffs on it, making it seem like no effort was made to refurbish or inspect the phone properly before selling it. 4. Battery Cycles Misleading: The phone already had 128 cycles, which isn’t what I would expect from a battery advertised as nearly new. This level of wear should have been disclosed upfront. 5. Stuck Without Options: I can’t go without a phone, so now I’m stuck with a subpar device in a predicament I didn’t sign up for.This was supposed to be a reliable, refurbished phone, but it feels like I’ve been sold something far from “excellent.” I’m very disappointed with this purchase and would strongly recommend others avoid this seller. If I had the option, I would return this immediately.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Perfect Good IPhone 15 Pro Max
review: Not bad for renewed came as described I wasn’t expecting to come in perfect condition but it did everything works great I tested everything on camera and just missing with it and so far everything has been working great . the only thing that was not bad but for some people they might care was battery capacity witch mine came at %90 and sometime I’ve seen them come as low as %80 but it’s not as bad if u don’t use ur phone on a hard use . Just something to keep in mind .

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
***BUYERS WITH SKEPTICAL ANXIETY***
review: ***BUYERS WITH SKEPTICAL ANXIETY***Lets start by saying the review i am about to leave will be my best one to date with tons of detailI spent literally about a week searching for phones that had been refurbished and sold on amazon. You can see that if you click on a specific phone then scroll down alittle there will be the same phone for sale but in different conditions. Most likely these other conditioned phones come from different companies. I seen alot of reviews about people getting scammed and or getting defective phones while scrolling through all the reviews for these companies starting from 1star to about 3 stars. (Obviously 4-5 stars will sell you on the product) after many hours on my venture for phones the one company that seemed to stand out was network store. The bad reviews they had was majorly from late delivery. For some reason these boys like to use FedEx and thats okay with me. I orded my first one and got it a day and a half later which was technically a day early from the original delivery date.When i opened the package to check the phone it was in great shape. There was afew minor issues but nothing for me to truly complain about considering the price. Once i started the hello screen and setting up the data transfer i noticed i got all the way to the end then the update on the new phone crashed.. i reset both phone in hopes that it would reset the transfer and update. I was wrong! It crashed the new phone i had got and during the transfer it disconnected my sim card from my other phone. I had two phones with no service! It was late that night so i woke up the next day and took the new phone to apple to get help or an explanation how to fix. They said they could help but they needed to plug the phone in to their repair laptop. I agreed then after plugging the phone in they realized the port of the phone was damaged and needed to be replaced which can cost anywhere from 300-700$ !!!! Grasping for both phones with anxiety and frustration i left the store and immediately went to a tech store to see what they would charge and they quoted the same. I went to my phone carrier to get another sim card which costed me $10 so i could have service again. then started the process of getting a refund on the amazon app. Amazon’s customer service reached out the the company to notify them of the issue and they confirmed i should hear back from the seller within 48hours. I eventually heard from the company and told them the issue. They immediately send a prepaid label to send the phone back to them in which i did that same day. 2 days later i received another 15 pro max 512gig black titanium phone that is nothing less than excellent shape. After a 16 hour data transfer i am now able to sit here and say these boys are the truth. They corrected a defective product with a even better one and didn't overly press about it. I can say i will be book marking this company in particular when it comes to buying anything refurbished again. I hope this can give someone an idea of the integrity they have. I will not deny that it was not an easy process and yes i did lowkey freak out thinking i was out of 950$ but they came through.The next best thing i can tell you is please do your research when it comes to jumping from an older phone or just a newer phone in general. I went from a 11pro max to a 15 pro max and the process of eliminating the physical sim card put me in a real bind.Last but not least, UPDATE THE PHONE FIRST!!!!!!!!After you update it then you can reset the phone then start the data transfer process. If all else fails you have to connect the phone to a laptop in DFU mode then manually update it. With the first phone i got i could have updated it first then loaded all my stuff on it and never knew the port had an issue. But since i did figure it out that means i couldn’t manually update it to fix the crashed out phone i got the first time.Once again thanks for correcting this. I cannot wait to take pictures and videos with my daughter this summer with my new phone.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2025
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Exceptional iPhone
review: I recently purchased this phone, and it arrived in absolutely flawless condition. The battery cycle count was impressively low at just 2, indicating minimal use. However, I found it quite puzzling that my app indicated it was ineligible for trade-in, which seemed rather suspicious. I reached out to Apple for clarification, but they were unable to provide an explanation for this issue. Despite this, the phone functioned perfectly for all my needs, and I absolutely adore it.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great phone for the price!
review: I got the phone in three days. It was gonna be two, but it got delayed in shipping. It said it would be a week before I got it, so I requested a refund, and they gave me it. The phone has very minimal imperfections, so you have to take a light at it actually to see anything. The condition I got in was excellent, and I would say it is in excellent condition because the battery health is 99%.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2025
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Solid Performance for a Renewed Device, but Expect Signs of Wear
review: I purchased the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max (Renewed) because I didn’t see the need to pay full price for a brand-new device. The phone arrived in an aftermarket box with a third-party charger, which I expected and had no issue with.The phone itself had small scratches and noticeable wear on the casing, which was disappointing but understandable for a renewed product at a discounted price.The battery life is decent. I ran a battery health check upon receiving it and found it had around 250 charging cycles, which was more than I expected given the release date. That said, after four months of use, the battery has held up well and hasn’t been a concern.Performance-wise, the phone is fast, responsive, and everything I expected from the 15 Pro Max. I love the USB-C charging and having access to the new Apple AI features, which makes the experience even better.Overall, this is a great option if you’re okay with some wear and tear. It offers solid performance at a more reasonable price, but just manage your expectations regarding the cosmetic condition.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Glad I purchased
review: This was so super easy to set up. I didn’t even have to call my cellular company to switch my service. It automatically seamlessly did it while I was setting up the phone. Also, I’m happy that I bought it from Amazon versus getting it from my mobile carrier because I got the one terabyte Storage for less than $1000 and the mobile company would’ve had 250 GB for over $1000 so I am happy with my purchase. This phone has had no issues there wasn’t a lot of cosmetic damage. There was like a film around the camera that seemed like it was like some plastic that didn’t get ripped off correctly but other than that, the phone came perfect I have no Problems with it at all.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone Pro 15 Max
review: I went from an 11 year old iPhone 7 Plus to an iPhone Pro 15 Max and was so worried about making the switch. The 15 uses a different cable than the 7 lightening cable so needed to invest in a few extra cables and plug in bricks. Overall, a very worthwhile switch.  It was super easy to put all my 7 Plus iPhone info into the new 15 iPhone. Make a back up of old iPhone in iTunes and be sure to tick the box, name it, then use that to set up new iPhone. Is faultless, smooth. A bit of a learning curve learning how to navigate the new iPhone, first knowing how to navigate without the button, but read, read, read. Ask Siri as new methods are needed. LEARN, be patient. Practice, remember. Nobody be afraid to upgrade. Was sooooo worth it. Thanks tech heads.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Nearly impossible to tell from brand new......except the box
review: Beautiful iPhone. Can't find a scratch or even a sleek anywhere on it. Battery is 100%. Manufacture was in Jan 2024 and was first started in Apr 2024. rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone 15 Pro Max
review: I really love this phone. I upgraded from the iPhone 12 to the 15 Pro Max and I’m loving it so far. But here are only a few complaints… When I bought this phone, I transferred all my data and stuff from my old phone to this new one. But, when I tried to get this phone activated, my phone carrier said this phone was still locked, even though on here, it says it’s unlocked. And I had a hard time getting my eSIM cut on, so that was a hassle. And then, the battery health is on 89%. Which isn’t that bad, but I thought it would at least be on 99% or something for this price. But other than that, there’s no scratches or anything broken on this phone and it looks brand new. I give it a 4 star.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Satisfied
review: I was not sure what to expect with a refurbished phone off Amazon, but I was very pleasantly surprised of the quality and ease of setup with my iPhone 15 pro max. It seemed like a brand new phone except for one thing.. while setting up my phone it presented me with the option of my phone number or a different number I did not recognize. I’m guessing this is the previous owners phone number. This number remained in the phone settings until I did a deep dive and deleted the e-sim from that number. Other than that weird encounter every thing else was smooth. Setup was easy, no Verizon store visit, used iCloud and e-sim transfer.

Locked for 60 days
review: Phone description says it’s unlocked but my carrier said otherwise so I had to call Verizon to have them unlock it and they were unable to, turns out it is a prepaid service only phone and the phone has to be activated with Verizon for 60 days before it becomes unlocked so I’m paying for 2 phones for 60 days since I don’t want to lose my old number. Not a HUGE deal but just wanted people to be aware before they went through the hassle that I did in order to get to figure it out.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Dissatisfied
review: I have previously bought an iPhone 14 pro from the seller (DirectCertified) and had a good experience with them. I was hoping that this iPhone 15 Pro Max would be in excellent condition also but to my surprise this one was a bit worse. First the frame around the phone has some deep scratches that are visible from 12 inches away. The screen looks alright with one small deep scratch and is still visible even with the screen protector on. The back glass is flawless and no scratches including the cameras.I am satisfied with the battery health at 100% 84 Cycles. Although I don’t feel this was worth the price, if your spending around 1k for this for excellent quality, i expect it to be near flawless. I had high expectations but I guess you just have to be lucky with what you get.

I don’t know what service provider it’s locked to either… apart from that the phone functions well and it was in mint condition. Unlocking iPhones can be really expensive though so I’m actually till upset because the phone actually does not worth the money I paid for it. A lot of bad reviews are under this sellers name so be careful when buying! Honestly I think that this seller should be removed from Amazon marketplace because of their dishonesty to me and many others!

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Cell signal?
review: Comparing this to my Galaxy Z Fold five's cell signal and I live in a basement apartment my Fold five picks up four bars but this iphone 15 pro max only picks up one bar so you can see who the winner is when it comes to the cell signal. This is my first iphone since the iphone 5 so I don't know why I just had to gravitate back to an Apple cell phone but now that I have it I'll make the best of it. Just to say that Apple is clearly not the leading innovator and really needs to step up their game. By the way you will not get the full year warranty from this vendor. Mine expires November 2024

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Phone works like new.
review: I can hardly believe this phone is refurbished - it seems brand new. I haven't bought refurbished electronics before.I usually hang on to my phones until they quit working and then buy a new one from the wireless provider, but this time I wanted an unlocked phone. It looks new and functions perfectly, and was very reasonably priced for an unlocked phone that will allow me to change wireless providers. Setting up the esim card was a bit complicated for me; I think it's easy to think something isn't working at first. Maybe it depends on your wireless provider, though. I had my tech-savvy daughter help me with the set-up, and it works great.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Worth the Price
review: I am really, really satisfied with this purchase.  I destroyed my IPhone 15 and I didn’t want to spend all that money for a new one.  I looked all over and this was the best quality for the price I could find!  I took it to Best Buy and it was verified to have all Apple parts.  There was some kind of condensation or something on the inside of the camera lens but it doesn’t seem to interfere with my photos.  I will use these guys again in the future.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2025
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Non genuine Apple parts used to refurbish iPhone.
review: I didn’t want to spend $1,000 on a brand-new phone for my older mother, so I thought a $400 refurbished iPhone would be a smart, budget-friendly choice (especially since it would be her first iPhone). We went to our wireless carrier to add her to my plan, and right off the bat, the phone was set to a different language. It took two employees 15 minutes just to switch it to English.We proceeded with transferring her phone number over and basic setup of the phone. When we got home, I created an Apple ID for her and tried to add her emai…then I saw a red notification in Settings that said, “Unknown Part.” Tapping it revealed a message stating “Unable to verify if display is a genuine Apple part.” Are you serious?So now, after spending my entire Sunday setting everything up, I’m going to have to undo it all and return this phone. I’m furious. Beyond furious. My mom doesn’t understand phone plans; my dad handled all of that, and he passed away recently. I added her to my plan to help her and to make sure that she has reliable way of communicating since I moved to Texas, and she’s back in California. We set up her phone during her one-week visit out here and she is set to fly home tomorrow. The phone is already tied to mine and my husbands plan, and her plan she had with my father is cancelled. And for anyone who has ever dealt with changes on a phone plan knows that the main account holder is the person who has to do everything. Which means I will need to send my mother home without a phone until we get a new phone and I drag my husband once again down to the store to connect the new phone, I’ll have to reset up the new phone and then mail it from Texas to her in California. And all the while, will have no way of contacting her… and she will have a phone to contact anyone.The fact that the phone was repaired using non-genuine Apple parts completely derailed everything. This wasn’t an accident—it was deliberate. The seller knowingly passed off a product with unauthorized repairs as a legitimate iPhone and charged accordingly. That’s not just misleading—it’s fraud.A simple refund isn’t enough. This seller should be removed from Amazon Prime, and Amazon needs to do a better job vetting Prime sellers. I’ve always trusted Amazon to ensure its Prime vendors are reputable, but clearly, that trust was misplaced. Lesson learned.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
5 STARS!!!!!!!! NO COMPLAINTS HERE
review: I ordered this phone in excellent condition and it was just THAT !!! Excellent just like as described . Besides a little dent on the bottom corner of the phone which obviously doesn’t interfere with the functionality of the phone , it other wise looks flawless upon unboxing !!! Not a single scratch . Battery life at 98% when I received it (REALLY GOOD BATTERY LIFE) beyond what I was expecting , and charges really fast with charging cable I’ve already had laying around from old previous phones . Had no problem connecting this phone with my courier . Honestly no complaints on my end . For $400 it’s a major steal I am pleased with my purchase from this seller . If you’re thinking about purchasing a phone from this specific seller , do it . Highly recommend you won’t be disappointed

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Premium
review: After reading other reviews, I decided to go with Amazon Renewed premium. Phone looked like it was new without any scratches or unusual wear. After transferring information from old phone to this one and updated apps, the phone works flawlessly. I found two things wrong and not really wrong, but it did not come with any kind of instructions, and battery life was at 84 percent. I was hoping for higher battery life, but it is what it is. All in all, I'm pretty satisfied with my purchase.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2025
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Faulty product, no support.
review: Front camera stopped working completely after only 6 months.  Of course, this was outside the 90 day window of returns for an "excellent" condition product.  It had to be "premium" to qualify for the year warranty.  So learning from experience, read carefully which category your product falls into.  It is sad that Amazon puts their name on the product in their renewed store, but will offer little to no support when it is obviously a defect in the product and not user use or damage.  I learned this lesson and will NEVER buy a product from the renewed store.  Buyer beware.

rating_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2025
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Screen is bent.
review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



Currently trying to reach the seller to no avail.Obviously, I know this is a refurbished phone so I don’t by any means expect perfect. BUT my phone screen was very obviously replaced with probably something cheap. It feels cheap, the camera quality is affected by it AND the biggest issue the screen is bowed!!! I kept trying to put a screen protector on and around the edges would not go down no matter how much I pushed it down and held it down. It would bubble right back up immediately. I tried FIVE separate screen protectors!!! Absolutely unacceptable I HAVE to have a screen protector. No if ands or buts about it.So my next step if they still don’t respond is to return and get my money back and order elsewhere.Such a shame.
